'''''The Lord of the Rings: A Book of 20 Postcards''''' is a book containing twenty postcards with illustrations inspired by ''[[The Hobbit]]'' and ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''. 

==Contents==

#David Alter: ''Bilbo's Great Adventure''
#[[Lode Claes]]: ''The Old Forest''
#[[:Category:Images by Stephen Walsh|Stephen Walsh]]: ''[[:File:Stephen Walsh - Carn Dum.JPG|Carn Dûm]]''
#[[Stephen Hickman]]: ''[[:File:Stephen Hickman - Parapets of Angband.jpg|The Parapets of Angband]]''
#[[Ted Nasmith]]: ''Riders at the Ford''
#[[John Howe]]: ''Horseman in the Night''
#[[Ted Nasmith]]: ''Gandalf Escapes on Gwaihir''
#[[Cor Blok]]: ''The Chamber of Mazarbul''
#[[Stephen Hickman]]: ''[[:File:Stephen Hickman - Gandalf and the Balrog.jpg|Gandalf and the Balrog]]''
#[[Cor Blok]]: ''Frodo's Vision''
#[[Cor Blok]]: ''The Battle of the Hornburg''
#[[Alan Lee]]: ''The Window on the West''
#[[Luca Michelucci]]: ''"Forward, Theoden kinghts!"''
#[[:Category:Images by David Wyatt|David Wyatt]]: ''[[:File:David Wyatt - Eowyn and the Nazgul.jpg|Eowyn and the Nazgûl]]''
#[[Alan Lee]]: ''The Black Gate Opens''
#[[Ted Nasmith]]: ''Across Gorgoroth''
#[[John Howe]]: ''The End of the Third Age''
#[[Alan Lee]]: ''Return to the Shire''
#[[:Category:Images by David Wyatt|David Wyatt]]: ''The Grey Havens''
#[[Roger Garland]]: ''[[:File:Roger Garland - Middle-earth.jpg|Middle-earth]]''

==From the back==

A book of 20 postcards featuring paintings inspired by the work of J.R.R. Tolkien. Artists include Ted Nasmith, John Howe, Alan Lee, Roger Garland, Cor Blok and Stephen Hickman.
